curam.util.client.view
Interface RendererContext

All Superinterfaces:
curam.util.client.model.Context, curam.util.client.model.DataAccessorContext, curam.util.client.model.DomainsContext, curam.util.client.model.StylesContext
public interface RendererContext
extends curam.util.client.model.DataAccessorContext, curam.util.client.model.DomainsContext, curam.util.client.model.StylesContext

The renderer context allows a renderer to access context information that may be necessary when rendering data. The renderer context provides mechanisms to access the values of server interface properties, it tracks the current index for list properties, etc. A renderer context is only valid for the life of the single renderer object for which it is created.

Method Detail

addFormItem

java.lang.String addFormItem(Field field,
                             java.lang.String label,
                             java.lang.String extendedPath)
                             throws ClientException
Adds a form item to the context for the given field, label, and extended target path (if any). A target ID value is returned that must be used to identify the form control that corresponds to the form item. The mandatory indicator will be set to false. See RendererContext.addFormItem(Field, String, String, boolean) for more details on the handling of the mandatory indicator.

Parameters:
field - The field related to the form item. This must not be null and must contain a binding that has a target path set to a server interface property.
label - A label to use for the form item. This will be used if any errors occur during processing. This may be null (in which case, an empty string will be used), but it is strongly recommended that a proper label be provided, or errors will cause confusion for users.
extendedPath - An optional extended path for this field. This may be used if a field is associated with a number of separate controls. Address fields are an example. If not needed, null may be used.
Returns:
A target ID value that must be used to identify the corresponding form control.
Throws:
ClientException - If the field is invalid. Typically, it may not have a proper binding to a target BOPI property.

addFormItem

java.lang.String addFormItem(Field field,
                             java.lang.String label,
                             java.lang.String extendedPath,
                             boolean mandatory)
                             throws ClientException

Adds a form item to the context for the given field, label, extended target path (if any), and mandatory indicator. A target ID value is returned that must be used to identify the form control that corresponds to the form item. See RendererContext.addFormItem(Field, String, String) for more details on the parameters.

The mandatory indicator may be used when processing form items after the user has submitted the form. If a mandatory form item has no value, an error may be reported. This supports the cases where a single BOPI property is presented as multiple form items (for example, an address). Even if the mandatory indicator is set to false, an error will still occur if no value is entered and the BOPI property was marked as mandatory in the model. This is required to enforce the interface requirements defined for the application server, something that the client has no right to override. As the mandatory indicator will default to false, this method is not required when adding form items without any extended path, as the BOPI property's mandatory flag will always take precedence.

Parameters:
field - The field related to the form item.
label - A label to use for the form item.
extendedPath - An optional extended path for this field.
mandatory - Indicates if a value must be entered for this form item.
Returns:
A target ID value that must be used to identify the corresponding form control.
Throws:
ClientException - If the field is invalid. Typically, it may not have a proper binding to a target BOPI property.

getFormItemInitialValue

java.lang.String getFormItemInitialValue(Field field,
                                         boolean useDefault,
                                         java.lang.String extendedPath)
                                         throws ClientException,
                                                DataAccessException

Gets the initial value for an input field on a form. This is only for use from "edit-renderer" plug-ins and may be used to get the correct initial value for fields that are added as form items by the addFormItem methods, including cases where validation errors have occurred and forms are being re-displayed with the user's previously entered values.

The initial value is not always the value of the source path (or the default value where the source path is null). If a user enters an invalid value on a form and an error occurs, then, when the form is shown again, the initial value will be the invalid value that the user entered and not the original source value (or default value). For valid values, this behavior is also used when, for example, restoring the form values entered as the criteria for a search operation when the criteria are submitted and the search results are displayed.

Where the values from the previous form have been forwarded for re-display, the initial value will always be the previously entered value. The value from the source path or the default value will never be used, even if the previously entered value is null. However, the previously entered value will only be null for controls like HTML check-boxes. These controls do not submit any value when unchecked, so a null initial value can be assumed to represent an unchecked check-box.

When there is no source path or the path evaluates to no value, and where no previously entered values (for any target) were forwarded, the initial value may be the "displayed default value" for the domain associated with the field. This default value is controlled by other plug-ins and its use may be enabled or disabled for each field. Use the useDefault parameter to enable this fallback.

For a field associated with a code-table domain, the initial value selection is more complex. It is assumed that the value sent to a target is always the code-table code, not the localized description text, so the initial value will always be the code-table code, so, in the absence of a previously entered value, the raw code value from the source path is used, not the formatted description value.

Parameters:
field - The field whose value is required. This must not be null and must contain a binding that has a target path set to a server interface property.
useDefault - true if the displayed default value should be used if the source or previous target values are not available, false otherwise.
extendedPath - The extension to the target path. This may be null if no extension is required.
Returns:
The initial value for the field. This may be null when previous values were forwarded, but no previous value was found; or there is no source path and the use of the default value is disabled.
Throws:
ClientException - If the field is invalid. Typically, it may not have a proper binding to a target BOPI property.
DataAccessException - If the source path cannot be resolved.

getFormItemInitialValues

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFormItemInitialValues(Field field,
                                                          boolean useDefault,
                                                          java.lang.String extendedPath)
                                                          throws ClientException,
                                                                 DataAccessException
Similar to the getFormInitialValue, however the list of values for an input field on a form where the field is associated with multiple values (select box).

Parameters:
field - The field whose value is required. This must not be null and must contain a binding that has a target path set to a server interface property.
useDefault - true if the displayed default value should be used if the source or previous target values are not available, false otherwise.
extendedPath - The extension to the target path. This may be null if no extension is required.
Returns:
The initial values list for the field.
Throws:
ClientException - If the field is invalid. Typically, it may not have a proper binding to a target BOPI property.
DataAccessException - If the source path cannot be resolved.

The page ID.

includeScripts

void includeScripts(java.lang.String scriptType,
                    java.lang.String... scripts)
Includes one or more in-line scripts into the current page. The scripts will be included at the end of the page after all of the script files have been included. Duplicated scripts are permitted.

Parameters:
scriptType - The type of the script. If the type is null or empty, "text/javascript" will be used.
scripts - The code for one or more scripts to be included.

includeScriptURIs

void includeScriptURIs(java.lang.String scriptType,
                       java.lang.String... scriptURIs)
Includes one or more script URIs on the current page. The script URIs will be included at the end of the page before all of the in-line scripts. Duplicate script URIs will be discarded.

Parameters:
scriptURIs - The URIs of the resources containing the script code.
scriptType - The type of the script. If the type is null or empty, "text/javascript" will be used.

includeScriptsFor

void includeScriptsFor(java.lang.String... features)
Includes the necessary scripts to support the specified features. Duplicate features will be discarded.

Parameters:
features - The names of the features.

indexContent

void indexContent(java.lang.String category,
                  java.lang.String... identifiers)
Associates one or more identifiers with a category of content on the HTML page. This information is made available on the page as a JavaScript data structure that associates the category with all identifiers belonging to that category. This can be used, for example, to identify widgets that need to be initialized by JavaScript code when the page is loaded. The data will be stored in the object "curam.content.INDEX". The identifiers will be retrieved in the order in which they are added.

Parameters:
category - The category that the content identifier should be associated with. This should be a valid JavaScript identifier.
identifiers - One or more identifiers to associate with the category. These can be element IDs, function names, or any other arbitrary strings that suit the required purpose.

render

void render(Component component,
            org.w3c.dom.DocumentFragment fragment,
            RendererContract contract)
            throws ClientException,
                   DataAccessException,
                   PlugInException
Renders the given component and captures the output of that rendering process in the given document fragment.

Parameters:
component - The component to be rendered.
fragment - The fragment that will contain the output.
contract - The contract between the renderers.
Throws:
ClientException - If the rendering fails.
DataAccessException - If a renderer cannot access the necessary data.
PlugInException - If a renderer cannot re-use another renderer.

getApplicationResourceURI

java.lang.String getApplicationResourceURI(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                           java.util.Locale locale)
                                           throws ClientException,
                                                  DataAccessException
Gets the relative URI for the named application resource and for the given locale. The content type, content disposition and character encoding in the subsequent response will be the same as those recorded for the resource.

Parameters:
resourceName - The name of the resource.
locale - The locale the resource is required for.
Returns:
The URI to insert into the HTML stream to reference the resource.
Throws:
ClientException - If the resource name or locale cannot be encoded for use in the URI.
DataAccessException - If the resource does not exist.

getApplicationResourceURI

java.lang.String getApplicationResourceURI(java.lang.String resourceName,
                                           java.util.Locale locale,
                                           java.lang.String contentDispositionType)
                                           throws ClientException,
                                                  DataAccessException
Gets the relative URI for the named application resource and for the given locale, overriding the content disposition type in the response to the given value. The content type, content disposition and character encoding in the subsequent response will be the same as those recorded for the resource, but the content disposition type will be overridden with the given value. Any parameters of the content disposition will be unchanged. The value of the content disposition type may be "inline" or "attachment"; other values will be silently ignored. For example, an image resource will typically be marked as "inline", but you may want to override this to "attachment" if you want the browser to prompt the user to save the image instead of viewing the image within the web page.

Parameters:
resourceName - The name of the resource.
locale - The locale the resource is required for.
contentDispositionType - The content disposition type to use to override the recorded type for the resource. If this is null, the recorded type will be used.
Returns:
The URI to insert into the HTML stream to reference the resource.
Throws:
ClientException - If the resource name or locale cannot be encoded for use in the URI.
DataAccessException - If the resource does not exist.

getApplicationResourceURI

java.lang.String getApplicationResourceURI(java.lang.String templateResourceName,
                                           java.lang.String propertiesResourceName,
                                           java.util.Locale locale)
                                           throws ClientException,
                                                  DataAccessException
Gets the relative URI for an application template resource. The named application template resource will be processed and property keys referenced in the template will be replaced with property values from the named properties resource. The resources will be selected for the given locale. The content type, content disposition and character encoding in the subsequent response will be the same as those recorded for the template resource.

Parameters:
templateResourceName - The name of the template resource.
propertiesResourceName - The name of the properties resource.
locale - The locale the resource is required for.
Returns:
The URI to insert into the HTML stream to reference the template resource after substituting the property values.
Throws:
ClientException - If the resource name or locale cannot be encoded for use in the URI.
DataAccessException - If a resource does not exist.

copyAndApplyIndex

<T extends Component> T copyAndApplyIndex(T component,
                                          java.lang.Object index)
Copies the given component and applies an index to any paths encountered. This is a deep copy operation. See the ComponentBuilder.copy(Component, Object) method for more details.

Type Parameters:
T - Represents any component type that may contain properties that are required to be indexed.
Parameters:
component - The component to be copied and indexed. If the specified component is null, then null will be returned.
index - The index to be applied to any path of the component that may be indexed.
Returns:
A copy of the specified component with the index applied to any paths that are required to be indexed. Null is returned if the component specified to be copied is null.
